note_text: OPERATIVE NARRATIVE: The patient was placed under general anesthesia. Following airway inspection, the Monarch robotic endoscope was deployed. Electromagnetic registration achieved a high accuracy (3.7mm error). The device was meticulously navigated to the Right Middle Lobe. The sheath was anchored at the RB5 ostium. The inner scope was advanced to the target lesion in the Medial Segment. Radial EBUS demonstrated an adjacent acoustic signature. Under continuous direct visualization and fluoroscopic guidance, transbronchial needle aspiration was performed using a 21-gauge needle for seven passes. Rapid on-site evaluation was suspicious for non-small cell carcinoma. Bronchoalveolar lavage was also completed.

note_text: PROCEDURE REPORT: Mrs. Lee presented for evaluation of a dominant left lower lobe nodule. Under general anesthesia, the Monarch robotic platform was utilized. Following precise electromagnetic registration (4.8mm error), the scope was navigated to the Anteromedial-Basal Segment of the LLL. Radial endobronchial ultrasound confirmed lesion adjacency. Diagnostic sampling was executed via transbronchial needle aspiration (19G, 7 passes) and transbronchial forceps biopsy (6 specimens), maintaining constant visualization. Lavage was performed. Preliminary cytology showed no malignant cells.
